website_summaries.verdict: An electric precision scale that is made for laboratories and measures to 0.001 g.
pros: A good price compared to other laboratory scales
Digital scale with an LED readout screen
User manual is easy to understand and useful
Has a range of up to 200 grams
cons: The sensors on this scale are temperature sensitive, requiring the scale to be at room temperature in order to be most accurate

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: tried to use this scale for reloading, measuring powder. scale is all over the place, I was constantly having to re-zero it. tried a few different times, problem just seemed to get worse.
customer_reviews.author: anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Great lab grade scale for a very reasonable price.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great digital scale, which I have been able to easily replicate results with. Very accurate and for the price around $120 this was a great deal compared to other lab grade scales. You must correctly set up the scale and calibrate correctly in order for it to work, but the user manual included is very well set up and provided me all the information I needed. It's also very important that the scale is used at a constant temperature as the sensors inside are temperature sensitive, so when it's first set up it needs to come to the same temperature as the room for accuracy.
customer_reviews.author: Blake

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work right
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't work right at all as it should. Have had it boxed until now and tried it doesn't work well. Would like to return it as it wasn't even used and isn't working right.
customer_reviews.author: Ownst

customer_reviews.title: Failed after 7 months.
customer_reviews.text: Scale stopped working after 7 months. Will not turn on anymore. Adaptor was replaced and didn't solve the problem. Mainboard is likely the issue. Scale was used in a clean and controlled environment. Edit: Manufacturer will proceed with warranty claim. Changing review grade.
customer_reviews.author: Ernesto Chavez

customer_reviews.title: Great Scales
customer_reviews.text: I only need these to go two places but instead they go to 5 places!! These are to replace my other scales that finally gave out. These scales were to replace those scales, and they were cheaper....
customer_reviews.author: B Lester

customer_reviews.title: Missing parts, damaged parts on arrival
customer_reviews.text: The unit came with dents and scratches on the actual pan for weighing materials, and only 2 sides and the top of the air shield (missing two sides).
customer_reviews.author: customer

customer_reviews.title: Performs as it should.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent scale. Just remember to let scale warm up before using it if you want the most accurate readings. This is true of all similar type scales.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Thorson

customer_reviews.title: As described
customer_reviews.text: Serves its purpose, easy to use, no complaints at this point.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda H.

customer_reviews.title: If you are looking for a reloading scale
customer_reviews.text: This product works GREAT!! It does not weight grains, but you can convert grams to grains and the scale is seriously accurate +/- .01 to .03 compared to my Gemoro 250 Platinum which does measure in grains.
customer_reviews.author: TODD G MARCUS

customer_reviews.title: use value vs price
customer_reviews.text: This is a very valuable balance with reasonable and competitive price.
customer_reviews.author: Fengzhi Li

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Looks like some pieces are missing because the draft shield can no be assembled.
customer_reviews.author: am

customer_reviews.title: Balance Hill
customer_reviews.text: Ok Thank You It seems difficult to buy a 1 Milligram Balance for that Price ?
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great! I use it for cosmetic formulating
customer_reviews.text: I love that it goes to .0001. The "roof" plate as it were, doesn't change the tare so you can take it on and off depending on what stage of the process you're in. Great for its price point. Probably wouldnt use it for quantitative analysis but it works for small measurements.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: 200x0.001g 1mg Digital Analytical Balance Precision Scale for Laboratories
feature_bullets: Measurement: 200 g Rang; 0.001 g (1 mg) resolution; ±0.002 g Accuracy
With Unit conversion: ounce, karat, gram, pound
With manual calibration, tare function, part count function
